page.title: 09OVER WYRESDALE: WOODLAND
page.content: The woodland here lies largely in the valleys of the R.Wyre and its tributary streams, though there are some isolated stands. It is mixed woodland - conifers and deciduous trees, (mainly oak, sycamore and beech). To the east 300 acres are owned by the Grosvenor Estates. This is well maintained, primarily for the purpose of breeding and rearing game birds (predominantly pheasants) rather than for commercial timber. The pheasants are incubated from eggs in large numbers and are released into the woods at the age of 8 weeks. They then grow to maturity in the wild. Game poaching, mainly for pheasants, is one of the main offences committed in the area, another being that of illegally disturbing and attempting to steal birds of prey - Schedule 1 specially protected birds.
